title: Quarkus returns rest client response instead of resource response when rest client calls the another endpoint in the api
body:
### Describe the bug

If you call a rest resource with an endpoint ENDPOINT_1 and inject a rest client, which calls another endpoint ENDPOINT_2 in the same API (i.e. "localhost:8081/...), the resource does not return the response specified in ENDPOINT_1, but returns the response the rest client got from endpoint 2

### Expected behavior

the response specified in ENDPOINT_1  should be returned

### Actual behavior

the response specified in ENDPOINT_2 is returned

### How to Reproduce?

https://github.com/sostrich/quarkus-recursive-restclient-bugreproducer/blob/main/src/test/java/org/acme/GreetingResourceTest.java

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "17.0.4" 2022-07-19 OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-17.0.4+8 (build 17.0.4+8) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-17.0.4+8 (build 17.0.4+8, mixed mode, sharing)

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.6.5

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.9.3

### Additional information

_No response_
